subject: Art & Design
title: Modular and Prefab: Factory-Made Buildings
description: A 60-second lesson on Modular and Prefab: Factory-Made Buildings.

hook.text: A Chinese company 3D-printed 10 houses in 24 hours. Each cost under $5,000. The construction industry noticed.

buildup.text: Prefab construction assembles building sections in factories, then ships and connects them on site.

discovery.text: Factory conditions mean higher quality, less waste, faster construction, and fewer weather delays.

twist.text: Prefab has a stigma: cheap, temporary, ugly. Modern modular architects are proving those stereotypes obsolete.

climax.text: 3D-printed concrete, cross-laminated timber, and robotics may make traditional construction the exception, not the rule.

punchline.text: The future of building might not happen at the building site.

quiz.question: What is the main advantage of prefab/modular construction?
options: Higher quality, less waste, and faster construction in controlled factory conditions
The buildings last longer than traditional ones
